text: That the other OAuth but private apps will work as well and those tokens are persistent

Hello. Is there a simple way of getting all related company records via the API? I mean all levels, children, siblings, parents, siblings children etc. I would like to avoid recursively moving up to the top and then doing the same the other way. Or would the best way be to make sure they share some other property and make searches based on that?

hello everyone! i am getting an issue with the feedback submissions api: i can access it with the api key, but not with the private app token. considering that starting december the api keys will be deprecated, i am trying to figure out how to retrieve data from feedback submissions. can anyone help me?
<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/migrate-an-api-key-integration-to-a-private-app#:~:text=In%20your%20HubSpot%20account%2C%20click,Click%20Create%20private%20app>.

i am familiar with the documentation. the weird thing is that on the private app log on HubSpot the http response is 200, but in the jupyter notebooks the displayed response is 401 (unauthorized). the category of the error is invalid authentication
every single other object is doing just fine, the issue is with feedback submissions

Hello everyone, Is anyone having an issues with the Blog Post API. I am trying to use `sort=-createdAt` or `sort=createdAt` but seem to be getting the same results back which is createdAt ordered ascending. Is there something i am doing wrong or is the API not working for this?
hello, is there any update in this subject?

Hello, I’m receiving a HTTP ERROR 415 for “Unsupported Media Type”. It’s just a GET in the endpoint bellow. My codebase is in Python.

Could anyone help me? Thanks!

```url_workflow = "<https://api.hubapi.com/automation/v3/workflows>"

headers = {
    "Content-Type": "application/json;charset=utf-8",
    "auth": f"BEARER {HS_TOKEN}"}

headers

response = rq.get(url_workflow, data=headers)
response.text

OUTPUT

('<html>\n<head>\n<meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="application/json;charset=utf-8"/>\n<title>Error 415 Unsupported Media Type</title>\n</head>\n<body><h2>HTTP ERROR 415</h2>\n<p>Reason:\n<pre>    Unsupported Media Type</pre></p>\n</body>\n</html>\n'```

Hi everyone! I was wondering if this was possible:

We have a client trying to build a prototype in which when a QR code get's scanned, the scanned item gets added to a quote as a line item OR it gets added to a cart.

Ha anyone tried anything like this in HubSpot ?

I know there is an endpoint that could help with this but I am unsure on the limitations, any information helps thanks!

Hi guys!
I used this url="<https://api.hubapi.com/form-integrations/v1/submissions/forms/b894443c-4d5b-4c28-9f7a-b36e7daa812a>" as url for /submissions/forms/ for private app as below.
```url="<https://api.hubapi.com/form-integrations/v1/submissions/forms/b894443c-4d5b-4c28-9f7a-b36e7daa812a>"
# url="<https://api.hubapi.com/form-integrations/v1/submissions/forms/b894443c-4d5b-4c28-9f7a-b36e7daa812a?hapikey=>"+api_key+"&limit=50"

headers = {
    'content-type': 'application/json',
    'authorization': 'Bearer %s' % api_client

}

response = requests.request("GET", url, headers=headers)

print(response.status_code)
print(response.text)```
But had 401 error,  I used my private app with other URL it worked fine but with form-id added I got error.
And I added almost all scope for the private app. Can anyone please tell what is the correct way?
```401 {"status":"error","message":"Authentication credentials not found. This API supports both API Key and OAuth 2.0 authentication and you can find more details at <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/auth/oauth-overview>","correlationId":"3f6e5697-0f97-40c7-ad66-367ed1768487"}```
You need to delete the hapikey from the url

This is commented out, I just showed as a reference to show how I did when I used api_key(before private app)
```# url="<https://api.hubapi.com/form-integrations/v1/submissions/forms/b894443c-4d5b-4c28-9f7a-b36e7daa812a?hapikey=>"+api_key+"&limit=50"```
oh sorry make "authorization" capital so "Authorization"
Thank you! But still have the same error :sweat_smile:
do you want to just try this in line 35: `'Authorization':'Bearer '+api_client
also do you have a value in api_client?
it should start with pat-
Yes I do
When I use this line 35: `'Authorization':'Bearer '+api_client , this error created
that means you don't have a string value in api_client
can you go to where you set that, it should be a string that starts with pat-
I changed with string I think it worked no I have this error
That means that form id doesn't exist
where did you get that form id

I used to have use this for api-key and it worked fine and it's formid that we created. url="<https://api.hubapi.com/form-integrations/v1/submissions/forms/b894443c-4d5b-4c28-9f7a-b36e7daa812a?hapikey=>"+api_key+"&limit=50"
Ok then are you using the same portal
Did you create that private app on the same portal where your api key is?
It's created from different account.
Then the form isn't going to exist
I see that was the reason. Then I will create a private app from the account that made the form

You need to generate a private app token from the settings of the HubSpot ui, then instead of having the apikey in the url parameters, add the bearer token (private app key) to the headers of the request
:+1::skin-tone-2:
Thank you so much!!
Of course
You probably need to expand the scopes of the private app key, try just turning on all of the scopes

What’s up guys
I’m a developer in HubSpot and i tryed to use this endpoint
‘<https://api.hubapi.com/crm/v3/objects/deals/{dealId}?idProperty={internalId}&hapikey=XXXXXXXXX>’
to update a property in deal from HubSpot, but the response callback this, someone can help me?
It’s something about permission ou something wrong in request?
No I don't think you need any scopes for that one, at least you don't for the v3 one
also probably want to just upgrade to the v3 api for support purposes <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/settings/account-information-api>
What does your real url look like? are you trying to update based on a record id or an id property like email?
I’m try to update a property from a deal
It’s this endpoint
replace pat-xxx with your private app key
Yes I understand but can you share an example url for your request? it looks like you're trying to update using an id property so I wanted to make sure you set it up correctly
Sorry what language is this?
c#
what library
just double check that there is a value inside of `{getContactByEmailAddressClass.EmailAddress}`  and replace pat-xxx with your private app token
Using RestSharp

```cUrl
curl --request PATCH \
  --url '<https://api.hubapi.com/crm/v3/objects/deals/11167318646?idProperty=conta_cartao_bairro&hapikey={apikey}> \
  --header 'content-type: application/json' \
  --data '{
  "properties": {
    "amount": "1500.00",
    "closedate": "2019-12-07T16:50:06.678Z",
    "dealname": "Custom data integrations",
    "dealstage": "presentationscheduled",
    "HubSpot_owner_id": "910901",
    "pipeline": "default"
    "conta_cartao_bairro": "teste"
  }
}'```
The properties
```{
  "amount": "1500.00",
  "closedate": "2019-12-07T16:50:06.678Z",
  "dealname": "Custom data integrations",
  "dealstage": "presentationscheduled",
  "HubSpot_owner_id": "910901",
  "pipeline": "default",
  "conta_cartao_bairro" : "teste"
}```
When i send the request this happen
sure give me a few will make up sample with that code
I think that there isn't a deal with a value of 11167318646 in the conta_cartao_bairro do you want to try and just do it with the HubSpot record id?
awesome
I will try it right now, and come back to you, thanks.
of course
This deal need the property were fill before the update?
Are you trying to update the property conta_cartao_bairro?
Yep

```'{"status":"error","message":"Any of the listed authentication credentials are missing","correlationId":"4cb0ab97-ef64-4966-b73a-e2e9cfad6731","engagement":{"oauth-token":"oauth-token not engaged. OAuth access token not found in request header.","hapikey":"hapikey not engaged. hapikey is not present in query params.","service-to-service":"service-to-service not engaged. Metadata for service-to-service request not found.","app-cookie":"app-cookie not engaged. App cookie is not present on the request.","internal-cookie":"internal-cookie not engaged. Cookie not found in the request."}}'```
Oh yeah you need to just putt the values you want to update in the properties object the idProperty is just if you're trying to identify the object with a different property over the deal id
It seems that in this way they don’t recognize the token
do you have a value in {HS_TOKEN}
yes, the pat token
Did you double check?
Like this?
Yes, look

the code is better written now, though :smile:

I mean, to HS collection
You don't need a hs collection just pop in the url and your bearer token

Hello Guys,

I have a problem creating contacts from the API. I am using the python library `HubSpot-api-client` to create contacts and passing the `HubSpot_owner_id` as a property along with the other data. But sometimes, the contact gets assigned to the default account owner and not the one I pass as an argument.

When I check the api_response, I get the correct `HubSpot_owner_id`, but don't see it assigned to the correct owner in the dashboard.
